title: Alberto Di Bernardo
text:
Alberto Di Bernardo (born 4 November 1980 in <a href="Rosario">Rosario</a>, <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>) is an <a href="Italy">Italian</a>/<a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, who gained four caps for in 2013. He played club rugby for <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Treviso</a> in <a href="Pro14">Celtic League</a>, <a href="Leeds%20Carnegie">Leeds Carnegie</a> in <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">Premiership Rugby</a> and for <a href="Bourgoin-Jallieu">Bourgoin</a> in the <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>. His usual position is at <a href="Fly-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">fly-half</a> and he has played for <a href="Italy%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy A</a>.
He played for Italy ‘A’ in the side that were beaten by <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Tonga</a> 33-27 in November 2005, his kicking helping to keep up the pressure on Tonga.
In 2007 he started his life as a <a href="Leeds%20Carnegie">Leeds Carnegie</a> player and secured them a place in the top flight of English rugby, the <a href="Guinness%20Premiership">Guinness Premiership</a>. After bouncing back between the top and second division, he decided to leave Leeds behind and take on the challenge of playing for <a href="Bourgoin-Jallieu">Bourgoin</a> in the <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>.
